meanings.sent1: The students were excited about the elect class trip to the zoo.
meanings.sent2: Her elect color was blue, so she painted her room accordingly.
meanings.sent3: The elect ice cream flavor turned out to be a strange mix of chocolate and mint.
meanings.sent4: The elect candidate for class president stood out with his unique ideas.
meanings.sent5: The elect book on the shelf caught her eye with its colorful cover.

meanings.definition: To choose or select by vote
meanings.sent1: The class will elect a new student council president next week.
meanings.sent2: The committee will elect a chairperson during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: In a surprising turn of events, they decided to elect the class clown as the spokesperson.
meanings.sent4: The members will elect their leader based on their speeches and ideas.
meanings.sent5: The town will elect a mayor to represent them in the upcoming election.

meanings.definition: To decide on or determine by choice
meanings.sent1: After much discussion, they will elect a date for the party.
meanings.sent2: The team will elect a captain for the upcoming match.
meanings.sent3: She had to elect between going to the movies or staying home to study.
meanings.sent4: The group will elect a spokesperson to present their ideas to the board.
meanings.sent5: It was time to elect a new color scheme for the office walls.
